title: ChannelProcess
description:
A process described as a sum of channels or through a single predefined coupling. Corresponds to a Higgs::predictions::ChannelProcess. Each channel is composed of a production and a decay mode. 
The first example shows what could be a fully inclusive SM-like Higgs search in the di-photon channel.
The second example shows a process interpreted in terms of a SM-normalized Higgs-top-Yukawa coupling, e.g. the CMS gg>H>tt search.

channels.description: A list of channels. The rate of the process is the sum of the rates of all channels.

channel.title: Channel
channel.description:
A single channel `p -> X -> d` composed of a production mode `p` and a decay mode `d` as `["p", "d"]`. If either of `p` or `d` is `"none"` it is ignored and the rate is purely determined by the other one.
 Therefore, the examples describe:

 1. the process `b b -> H -> b b`
 2. the single Higgs production cross section `p p -> H`
 3. the branching ratio of a particle into a photon pair.
